rules.natural: Provided that the facility loses its license, then it does not receive a fine.
If the facility exports to Country A, then when it fails inspection, the drug contains plant extracts.
The facility exports to Country A or to Country B.
If the facility merges with a competitor, then it rebrands.
If the facility merges with a competitor, then it restructures.
The facility merges with a competitor, or if it is audited, then it is approved by the FDA.
Provided that the facility produces a drug, then it is approved by the FDA.
If the facility restructures, then it does not rebrand.
When the drug contains plant extracts, then the facility produces the drug.
If the drug is tested in a financial product, then it contains plant extracts.
The facility uses an organic process or a synthetic process.
If the facility uses a synthetic process, then should it fail inspection, the drug is not contaminated.
If the facility receives government funding, then it complies with regulations.
Should it not be the case that compliance with regulations implies that using an organic process leads to non-contamination upon failed inspection, then the facility receives a fine.
If compliance with regulations does not result in the organic process ensuring non-contamination upon failed inspection, then the facility loses its license.
If exporting to Country B does not imply that upon failed inspection the drug contains plant extracts, then the drug is banned in Country B.
Should exporting to Country B not lead to the drug containing plant extracts upon failed inspection, then the drug is not banned in Country B.
If the failure of inspection not leading to drug production does not imply the drug fails the safety check, then the drug is fast-tracked.
Provided that the failure of inspection not leading to drug production does not result in the drug failing the safety check, then the drug is not fast-tracked.
If the failure of inspection does not lead to drug production, then the drug passes the safety check.
If the failure of inspection does not lead to testing in a financial product, then the financial product is profitable.
Provided that the failure of inspection does not imply testing in a financial product, then the financial product is not profitable.
If the facility fails inspection, then it is audited.
If the facility fails inspection, then the drug is contaminated.
Provided that the facility fails inspection, then it is not approved by the FDA.

(A10 → (A7 → (¬G → ¬A6))).natural: If the facility complies with regulations, then should it use an organic process, then under the condition that it fails inspection, the drug will not be contaminated.

(A12 → ¬A11).natural: Provided that the facility loses its license, then it does not receive a fine.

(A15 → (¬G → A3)).natural: If the facility exports to Country A, then when it fails inspection, the drug contains plant extracts.

(A15 ∨ A16).natural: The facility exports to Country A or to Country B.

(A16 → (¬G → A3)).natural: If the facility exports to Country B, then once it fails inspection, the drug contains plant extracts.

(A18 → A1).natural: When the facility is audited, then it is approved by the FDA.

(A19 → A20).natural: If the facility merges with a competitor, then it rebrands.

(A19 → A21).natural: If the facility merges with a competitor, then it restructures.

(A19 → ¬A20).natural: If the facility merges with a competitor, then it does not rebrand.

(A19 ∨ (A18 → A1)).natural: The facility merges with a competitor, or if it is audited, then it is approved by the FDA.

(A2 → A1).natural: Provided that the facility produces a drug, then it is approved by the FDA.

(A21 → ¬A20).natural: If the facility restructures, then it does not rebrand.

(A3 → A2).natural: When the drug contains plant extracts, then the facility produces the drug.

(A4 → A3).natural: If the drug is tested in a financial product, then it contains plant extracts.

(A7 → (¬G → ¬A6)).natural: If the facility uses an organic process, then under the condition that it fails inspection, the drug is not contaminated.

(A7 ∨ A8).natural: The facility uses an organic process or a synthetic process.

(A8 → (¬G → ¬A6)).natural: If the facility uses a synthetic process, then should it fail inspection, the drug is not contaminated.

(A9 → (A7 → (¬G → ¬A6))).natural: If the facility receives government funding, then provided it uses an organic process, then when it fails inspection, the drug is not contaminated.

(A9 → A10).natural: If the facility receives government funding, then it complies with regulations.

(¬(A10 → (A7 → (¬G → ¬A6))) → A11).natural: Should it not be the case that compliance with regulations implies that using an organic process leads to non-contamination upon failed inspection, then the facility receives a fine.

(¬(A10 → (A7 → (¬G → ¬A6))) → A12).natural: If compliance with regulations does not result in the organic process ensuring non-contamination upon failed inspection, then the facility loses its license.

(¬(A10 → (A7 → (¬G → ¬A6))) → ¬A11).natural: Provided that compliance with regulations does not lead to the organic process preventing contamination upon failed inspection, then the facility does not receive a fine.

(¬(A16 → (¬G → A3)) → A17).natural: If exporting to Country B does not imply that upon failed inspection the drug contains plant extracts, then the drug is banned in Country B.

(¬(A16 → (¬G → A3)) → ¬A17).natural: Should exporting to Country B not lead to the drug containing plant extracts upon failed inspection, then the drug is not banned in Country B.

(¬(¬(¬G → A2) → ¬A13) → A14).natural: If the failure of inspection not leading to drug production does not imply the drug fails the safety check, then the drug is fast-tracked.

(¬(¬(¬G → A2) → ¬A13) → ¬A14).natural: Provided that the failure of inspection not leading to drug production does not result in the drug failing the safety check, then the drug is not fast-tracked.

(¬(¬G → A2) → A13).natural: If the failure of inspection does not lead to drug production, then the drug passes the safety check.

(¬(¬G → A2) → ¬A13).natural: Should the failure of inspection not result in drug production, then the drug does not pass the safety check.

(¬(¬G → A4) → A5).natural: If the failure of inspection does not lead to testing in a financial product, then the financial product is profitable.

(¬(¬G → A4) → ¬A5).natural: Provided that the failure of inspection does not imply testing in a financial product, then the financial product is not profitable.
